info.title: Vehicle API
info.description: A vehicle is a device that is designed or used to transport people or cargo over land, water, air, or through space.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Keyword search for item

parameters.name: additionalproperty
parameters.description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org. Note: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

parameters.name: additionaltype
parameters.description: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the \'typeof\' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

parameters.name: aggregaterating
parameters.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

parameters.name: aircraft
parameters.description: The kind of aircraft (e.g., \"Boeing 747\").

parameters.name: alternatename
parameters.description: An alias for the item.

parameters.name: audience
parameters.description: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created. Supersedes serviceAudience.

parameters.name: award
parameters.description: An award won by or for this item. Supersedes awards.

parameters.name: brand
parameters.description: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

parameters.name: cargovolume
parameters.description: The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.Typical unit code(s): LTR for liters, FTQ for cubic foot/feetNote: You can use minValue and maxValue to indicate ranges.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

parameters.name: color
parameters.description: The color of the product.

parameters.name: datevehiclefirstregistered
parameters.description: The date of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: The depth of the item.

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A short description of the item.

parameters.name: drivewheelconfiguration
parameters.description: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle\'s engine via the drivetrain.

parameters.name: fuelconsumption
parameters.description: The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km.Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km.Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed (\"at 80 km/h\") or usage pattern (\"city traffic\"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.

parameters.name: fuelefficiency
parameters.description: The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter.Use unitText to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L.Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, fuelConsumption (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and fuelEfficiency (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed (\"at 80 km/h\") or usage pattern (\"city traffic\"). You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.

parameters.name: fueltype
parameters.description: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

parameters.name: gtin12
parameters.description: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

parameters.name: gtin13
parameters.description: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceeding zero. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

parameters.name: gtin14
parameters.description: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

parameters.name: gtin8
parameters.description: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See GS1 GTIN Summary for more details.

parameters.name: height
parameters.description: The height of the item.

parameters.name: image
parameters.description: An image of the item. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

parameters.name: isaccessoryorsparepartfor
parameters.description: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is an accessory or spare part.

parameters.name: isconsumablefor
parameters.description: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is a consumable.

parameters.name: isrelatedto
parameters.description: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

parameters.name: issimilarto
parameters.description: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

parameters.name: itemcondition
parameters.description: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition or a textual description of the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer.

parameters.name: knownvehicledamages
parameters.description: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

parameters.name: logo
parameters.description: An associated logo.

parameters.name: mainentityofpage
parameters.description: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described.            See background notes for details.       Inverse property: mainEntity.

parameters.name: manufacturer
parameters.description: The manufacturer of the product.

parameters.name: mileagefromodometer
parameters.description: The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.Typical unit code(s): KMT for kilometers, SMI for statute miles

parameters.name: model
parameters.description: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

parameters.name: mpn
parameters.description: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The name of the item.

parameters.name: numberofairbags
parameters.description: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

parameters.name: numberofaxles
parameters.description: The number of axles.Typical unit code(s): C62

parameters.name: numberofdoors
parameters.description: The number of doors.Typical unit code(s): C62

parameters.name: numberofforwardgears
parameters.description: The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.Typical unit code(s): C62

parameters.name: numberofpreviousowners
parameters.description: The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.Typical unit code(s): C62

parameters.name: offers
parameters.description: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event.

parameters.name: potentialaction
parameters.description: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an \'object\' role.

parameters.name: productid
parameters.description: The product identifier, such as ISBN. For example: <meta itemprop=\'productID\' content=\'isbn:123-456-789\'/>.

parameters.name: productiondate
parameters.description: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

parameters.name: purchasedate
parameters.description: The date the item e.g. vehicle was purchased by the current owner.

parameters.name: releasedate
parameters.description: The release date of a product or product model. This can be used to distinguish the exact variant of a product.

parameters.name: review
parameters.description: A review of the item. Supersedes reviews.

parameters.name: sameas
parameters.description: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item\'s identity. E.g. the URL of the item\'s Wikipedia page, Freebase page, or official website.

parameters.name: sku
parameters.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

parameters.name: steeringposition
parameters.description: The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the item.

parameters.name: vehicleconfiguration
parameters.description: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. \'5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp\' or \'limited edition\'.

parameters.name: vehicleengine
parameters.description: Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.

parameters.name: vehicleidentificationnumber
parameters.description: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

parameters.name: vehicleinteriorcolor
parameters.description: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

parameters.name: vehicleinteriortype
parameters.description: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

parameters.name: vehiclemodeldate
parameters.description: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

parameters.name: vehicleseatingcapacity
parameters.description: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.Typical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

parameters.name: vehicletransmission
parameters.description: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) (\"gearbox\" for cars).

parameters.name: weight
parameters.description: The weight of the product or person.

parameters.name: width
parameters.description: The width of the item.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique id for item

parameters.name: additionalproperty
parameters.description: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristics of the entitity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org. Note: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. In RDFa syntax, it is better to use the native RDFa syntax - the \'typeof\' attribute - for multiple types. Schema.org tools may have only weaker understanding of extra types, in particular those defined externally.

You can use valueReference to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.
